name: Teriyaki Chicken
method: Combine soy sauce, sugar, mirin, garlic, and ginger in a bowl. ... Add chicken to the bowl and marinate for at least 31 minutes. ... Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. ... Add chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes on each side. ... Serve with rice and steamed vegetables.

name: Okonomiyaki
method: Combine flour, egg, and water in a bowl. ... Add cabbage, green onion, and pork belly to the bowl and mix well. ... Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat. ... Add the batter to the griddle and cook for 5-6 minutes on each side. ... Top with mayonnaise and okonomiyaki sauce.

name: Miso Soup
method: Bring dashi to a simmer in a pot. ... Add miso paste and whisk until fully dissolved. ... Add tofu and simmer for 2-3 minutes. ... Top with green onion and seaweed.

name: Yakitori
method: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and thread onto skewers with sliced green onion. ... Mix together soy sauce, sake, and sugar to make a marinade. ... Brush the marinade onto the skewers and grill until fully cooked.

name: Tonkatsu
method: Pound the pork loin to tenderize and flatten. ... Coat the pork in flour, then beaten egg, and finally panko breadcrumbs. ... Heat vegetable oil in a pan and fry the pork until golden brown. ... Serve with tonkatsu sauce and shredded cabbage.

name: Udon Noodle Soup
method: Bring dashi to a boil in a pot. ... Add soy sauce and mirin, then reduce heat to a simmer. ... Cook udon noodles separately according to package instructions. ... Drain the noodles and add to the broth. ... Serve hot with sliced scallions.

name: Okonomiyaki
method: Mix the flour, water, and eggs together in a bowl to make the batter. ... Add the cabbage, bacon, and green onion to the batter. ... Heat a griddle or frying pan and pour the batter onto it. ... Cook the okonomiyaki for a few minutes on each side until golden brown. ... Top with mayonnaise and okonomiyaki sauce before serving.

name: Takoyaki
method: Mix the flour, water, and dashi together in a bowl to make the batter. ... Heat a takoyaki pan and pour the batter into the molds. ... Add pieces of octopus, bonito flakes, and scallions to each mold. ... Use a skewer to flip the takoyaki as they cook until golden brown on all sides. ... Top with mayonnaise and takoyaki sauce before serving.

name: Katsu Curry
method: Coat the chicken breast in flour, egg, and breadcrumbs. ... Fry the chicken in a pan until golden brown. ... In a separate pan, saut√© onions, carrots, and potatoes. ... Add water and curry powder to the vegetables and simmer until the sauce thickens. ... Serve the katsu curry over a bed of rice.

name: Tofu
method: Dredge the pork cutlet in flour. ... Dip the cutlet into beaten egg. ... Coat the cutlet in panko breadcrumbs. ... Heat the oil in a frying pan. ... Fry the cutlet until golden brown. ... Serve with tonkatsu sauce and shredded cabbage.

name: Udon
method: In a large mixing bowl, combine flour and salt. Add 1 1/4 cups water. Use hands to mix until dough starts to come together in a few large lumps. Firmly press and knead the dough, incorporating any loose flour until there is none left. If necessary, add a little more water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until you can incorporate all of the flour.

name: Udon Noodles
method: Cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions. ... In a separate pot, heat the broth and add the meat or tofu and vegetables. ... Simmer until the vegetables are tender. ... Add the cooked noodles to the pot and mix well. ... Beat the egg and pour it into the pot, stirring gently. ... Serve hot.

name: Sushi Roll
method: Place a sheet of nori on a sushi mat. Spread sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top. Place raw fish or vegetables in a line in the center of the rice. Roll the sushi tightly using the mat. Serve with wasabi and soy sauce.

name: Strawberry Mochi
method: Mix sweet glutinous rice flour and sugar in a bowl. Gradually add water while stirring until a dough is formed. Roll out the dough and cut into small pieces. Dust the pieces with potato starch. Flatten each piece and place a strawberry in the center. Fold the dough around the strawberry and pinch to seal. Steam the mochi for 10-15 minutes. Serve warm.

name: Soba Noodles
method: Cook soba noodles according to package instructions. In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, mirin, and sugar to make the dipping sauce. Serve the noodles with the dipping sauce, wasabi, sliced scallions, and crumbled nori seaweed.

name: Sukiyaki
method: Heat a large pot or skillet over medium heat. ... Add the beef and cook until browned. ... Add the tofu, mushrooms, and noodles. ... In a separate bowl, mix together sugar, soy sauce, sake, and mirin. ... Add the mixture to the pot and bring to a boil. ... Serve in bowls topped with sliced green onion.

name: Matcha
method: Sift the matcha powder into a bowl. ... Add hot water and whisk until smooth and frothy. ... Heat milk in a saucepan until steaming. ... Add sugar to taste. ... Pour the matcha into a cup and top with the steamed milk. ... Stir gently and enjoy!

name: Chicken Teriyaki Donburi
method: In a saucepan, combine soy sauce, mirin, sugar, rice vinegar, ginger, and garlic. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer. In a separate bowl, mix cornstarch and water to create a slurry. Add the slurry to the saucepan and stir until thickened. Set aside. Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and cook the chicken until browned and cooked through. Add the teriyaki sauce to the skillet and toss to coat the chicken. Serve the chicken and sauce over a bed of cooked rice, with steamed broccoli and sliced green onions as toppings.
